versos: (warmed) "I was a stranger and you welcomed me." - Matthew 25:35;;;
(hiding) Psalm 32:7 - "You are my hiding place; you will protect me from trouble and surround me with songs of deliverance.";;;
(furrows) Psalm 65:10 - You drench its furrows and level its ridges; you soften it with showers and bless its crops.;;
(burst) Jeremiah 23:29 - "Is not my word like fire, declares the Lord, and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces".;;;
(profited) Matthew 16:26 - "For what profit is it to a man if he gains the whole world, and loses his own soul Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul";;;
(worketh) Romans 4:15 - Because the law worketh wrath: for where no law is
(exalteth) Psalm 148:14 - "He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye the Lord.";;;
(counsels) Proverbs 19:21 - "Many are the plans in a persons heart, but it is the Lords purpose that prevails.";;;
(guide) Psalm 48:14: "For this God is our God for ever and ever; he will be our guide even to the end.";;;
(hardness) Romans 2:5 - But because of your stubbornness and unrepentant heart
(leaveth) Proverbs 19:6 - Many will intreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.;;;
(trusteth) Psalm 112:7 - "He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.";;;
(ham) Genesis 9:22 - "ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father and told his two brothers outside.";;;

(thorn) 2 Corinthians 12:7 - "or because of these surpassingly great revelations. Therefore, in order to keep me from becoming conceited, I was given a thorn in my flesh, a messenger of Satan, to torment me.";;;
(shaking) Hebrews 12:26 - At that time his voice shook the earth, but now he has promised, "Once more I will shake not only the earth but also the heavens.";;;
(wither) Isaiah 40:7 - "The grass withers and the flowers fall, because the breath of the Lord blows on them. Surely the people are grass.";;;
(potter) Isaiah 64:8 - "Yet you, Lord, are our Father. We are the clay, you are the potter; we are all the work of your hand.";;;
